meanings.definition: Format (something, especially a disk) in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before saving the document, make sure to preformat the USB drive.
meanings.sent2: I always preformat my external hard drive before transferring files.
meanings.sent3: The computer magician preformatted the disk with a flick of his wand.
meanings.sent4: She preformatted her mind with positive thoughts before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: Preformatting the memory card is like laying out a clean canvas for your photos.

meanings.definition: The action or process of formatting something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preformatting of the disk was necessary before storing any data.
meanings.sent2: I learned about preformatting during my computer science class.
meanings.sent3: The preformatting of the document felt like setting the stage for a play.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous preformatting of the report impressed the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The preformatting of the hard drive was like preparing the soil before planting seeds.
